snippet.title: Coast's ultimate one-stop-shop for custom furniture
snippet.content: A TIRED old industrial building will soon be transformed into one of the Sunshine Coast's ultimate one-stop-shops for custom furniture and interior decor. It's the dream of RAW Sunshine Coast owners Katie Bishop and Chris Rawlins, who have embarked on a journey to expand their burgeoning business operations into a central hub. The business currently has a store in the Sunshine Plaza and an off-site workshop, however, RAW Sunshine Coast will consolidate operations into a large new premises located in the Maroochydore Industrial Zone. The new location, at 23 Kayleigh Dr in Maroochydore, will house the business's custom furniture workshop, showroom and offices. In a special twist, owner Katie Bishop said the new home also had the potential to include a space for a coffee shop. "It's kind of been a bit of a dream of ours for the last three years," she said. "We've been searching for a free-standing building to house all of our operations in one and finally something came up." She said RAW would remain in the Plaza until the new home was established, which was expected to be open by the end of August. She said work was well under way to create an inviting space for customers. "It's a big industrial shed and it has needed a bit of love to bring it up to date," she said. "It's really exciting to get it all back together and just to let people actually see our furniture we make in a real life setting." Mrs Bishop said customers would also be able to explore RAW's full range of furniture, available timber and finish options. She said a viewing window from the showroom into the workshop would also allow visitors to catch a glimpse of the furniture making process. There had been plenty of interest from other businesses looking to set up at the new location according to Mrs Bishop. "We've had several inquiries already and we've had enquiries from other business so we're trying to squeeze possibly two (retail) spaces in there to create a collective hub," she said. To coincide with the opening of the new location, RAW have teamed up with a number of brands to give three lucky customers the chance to share in over $5,000 worth of interior decor products. To enter, customers need to spend a minimum of $50 in one transaction at RAW Sunshine Coast (in-store or online) and place the entry form into the barrel. The competition runs from the July 28 to September 30. Latest weather data points to big dry SELANGOR Private Hospital has celebrated its 70th birthday.
